Name: LiveStore
Description: Client-centric local-first data layer for high-performance apps

ClientBundleSize.comment: For web apps, LiveStore ships with a SQLite WASM build (~600kb / 300kb gzipped) and the library itself is around 500kb / 170kb gzipped.

Protocol.comment: Given LiveStore supports arbitrary sync backends, any kind of network protocol can be used.

PersistenceMechanism.comment: Almost anything works as long as it can persist an eventlog.

DataSize.comment: Theoretically there isn't an upper limit to the eventlog size however at some point it might become impractical to sync the eventlog over the network.

LocalRefreshLatency.comment: LiveStore is designed to enable next-frame refresh latency by using an in-memory SQLite database with a signals-based reactivivity system.

DataModel.comment: LiveStore follows the event sourcing pattern which separates writes into an eventlog and materializes state into a local SQLite database.

DataSize.comment: The upper limit is mostly determined by the used browser or client device. SQLite stores data fairly efficiently, so you should rarely hit any limits in regards to size.
